paragraphs.text: Study your market. Do the research. You ALWAYS have to do the research to understand your segment. Give your audience a compelling reason to want to learn more about you, while making it simple for them to gain access to the output you provide. Your customers will gain the most value when you create a great product/content and make it easy for them to get it.
paragraphs.name: 34ba

paragraphs.text: It is opportunity that comes knocking when you have built positive, synergetic relationships. This will be the lifeblood of your future success, whether you work for “the man” or yourself. It’s also how you will build future business, regardless of which industry or space you occupy.
paragraphs.name: 273b

paragraphs.text: This is very helpful. I’ve read a few articles on building my personal brand but yours made it very easy to understand. I’m definitely going to re-read and implement in my own life.
paragraphs.name: 420c

paragraphs.text: Thanks!
paragraphs.name: 5efb

5294b1a735e7.title: Deon Christie You’re preaching to the choir, my friend.

paragraphs.text: Deon Christie You’re preaching to the choir, my friend. I actually wrote an article in late February about this: https://medium.com/the-mission/do-it-because-you-believe-in-it-f6aa475ddb09. It is not easy to be original and unique. Which is why so many people take the easy way out. But that’s also why it’s hard to find great content. I humbly hope all of us are doing our part. Thanks for reading!
paragraphs.name: f65e

paragraphs.text: Thank you, Kimberly Flanagan. I’m so glad you liked it! Thanks for the positive feedback. Good luck to you!!

One point you wrote stuck with me the whole way through — reputation matters much more than character in business. It’s what we’ve done before and how we’ve done it that builds the stepping stones for the next big thing.
